report_title: Chemical Product Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Chemical product manufacturers have had to contend with uneven demand over the past five years, but changes in commodity prices have still allowed revenue growth for the industry. While the price of oil dropped as travel dropped off amid the COVID-19 pandemic, prices skyrocketed in the years following as pent-up demand was released. The Russian invasion of Ukraine led many nations to impose sanctions that cut the world supply of oil, exacerbating the increase in input costs for chemical product manufacturers even more. These heightened prices were successfully passed on to downstream industries through price increases.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Global tensions have brought price hikes
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Tensions generated by the Russian invasion of Ukraine have agitated trade relations with the Russian Federation and surrounding countries.
Demand has slumped from several key end markets, like automotive part manufacturers and construction companies.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Photo chemicals continue to become a thing of the past
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Changing consumer preferences for digital cameras has diminished the need for film-based cameras.
Many industry manufacturers have relocated production facilities overseas to reduce production and labor costs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Domestic and international regulations have grown
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Chemical manufacturers have faced increased scrutiny from regulatory bodies regarding the proper handling, transportation and disposal of chemicals.
Larger companies have increasingly pursued mergers and acquisitions to expand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Revenue is Set to Rise Despite Falling Input Prices
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Chemicals product manufacturers are expected to be relieved from high input costs in the coming years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit Gets Squeezed as the Industry Evolves
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Since crude oil prices are a key component of the industry's cost structure, price fluctuations will cause similar changes in industry cost structures and sales prices.
Manufacturers will have to cope with changing environmental regulations.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Escalating International Tensions Will Affect the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rising international tensions will impact the industry's input prices.
Increased awareness of conventional chemicals' environmental impact will drive industry R&D.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry manufacture a diverse range of chemical products. Key activities include custom compounding of plastic resins and manufacturing toners.

threats: Low Outlier Growth: World price of crude oil

key_trends: Larger manufacturers compete for bulk contracts with established manufacturers.
Increasing environmental regulations have forced manufacturers to innovate.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The construction sector purchases coil coatings, resins for carpet backing and sheet vinyl, concrete additives and retarders, including flame-proofing.
The construction sector purchases various chemical products for their needs.
Households purchase various chemical products for everyday use.
Automotive parts require various chemical inputs.

products_and_services.product_description: Custom compounded resins are specially formulated plastic materials.
A salt is an ionic compound formed by the neutralization reaction between an acid and a base.
Water treatment involves processes to ensure water quality.

tier_1_suppliers: Oxygen & Hydrogen Gas Manufacturing in the US
Plastic & Resin Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Organic Chemical Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Resin and other raw materials are derived from petrochemical-based feedstock.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Miscellaneous chemical products account for all other industry imports.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is the main region for chemical manufacturers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The chemical sector is one of the most regulated sectors in the United States.

basis_points.basis_description: Larger manufacturers compete for bulk contracts.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top three players account for 18.8% of total industry revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Input prices are the largest expense
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers purchase a variety of inputs depending on the kind of products they manufacture.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Prospective manufacturers will have to contend with wages for skilled laborers.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue for chemical product manufacturers has fluctuated considerably.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: A renewed push for environmental sustainability has led to innovation.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Imports have risen slightly in recent years but still occupy a lower share of overall domestic demand.
